instructions: 1 Start Eclipse, running JVM version 1.7.0 or later. Image titled P1s1 2 Select Help > Install New Software. Image titled Gp1s2 3 In the dialog that appears, enter the update site URL into the Work with text box: "https://dl.google.com/eclipse/plugin/4.3". Press the key. Image titled Gp1s3 4 Select the checkbox next to Google Plugin for Eclipse (required). Click . 5 Review the features that you are about to install. Click . Image titled Gp1s4 6 Read the license agreements and then select "I accept the terms of the license agreements". Click . 7 Click on the Security Warning. 8 Click Restart Now to restart Eclipse. Image titled Gp1s5 9 Sign in to Google by clicking in bottom-right corner. Provide the Google Account Credentials and Click . Image titled Gp1s6 Click Accept after reading the required permissions. Image titled Gp1s7 Now you are logged in to your Google Account. Image titled Gp1s8 You are ready to build App Engine web applications and mobile backends for your Android applications!
